article.title: Boxing_Day

article.paragraph: Boxing Dayis a holiday traditionally celebrated the day followingChristmas Day, when servants andtradesmenwould receive gifts, known as a "Christmas box", from their bosses or employers,cite bookParley, Peter (pseud.)Tales about Christmashttp://books.google.com/books?id26 December 20111838323â€“8in the United Kingdom, Barbados, Canada, Hong Kong, Australia, Bermuda, New Zealand, Kenya, South Africa, Guyana, Trinidad and Tobago, Jamaica and other former British colonies. Today, Boxing Day is thebank holidaythat generally takes place on 26 December.

In South Africa, Boxing Day was renamed Day of Goodwill in 1994. Due to the Roman Catholic Church's liturgical calendar, the day is known asSt. Stephen's Dayto Catholics, as well as in Italy, Finland, andAlsaceandMoselle (dpartement)Mosellein France. It is also known as both St. Stephen's Day and the Day of the Wren orWren DayWren's Dayin Ireland. In some European countries, most notably Germany, Poland, Belgium, the Netherlands and those in Scandinavia, 26 December is celebrated as theSecond Christmas Day.cite book21http://books.google.com/books?idChristmas Facts, Figures & Fun: Facts, Figures and Fun9781904332275BrownCameron28 August 2006
article.heading: Origins
article.paragraph: Various competing theories for the origins of the termboxing daycirculate in popular culture, none of which are definitive.cite webhttp://www.snopes.com/holidays/christmas/boxingday.aspsnopes.com: Boxing Day Originssnopes.comHowever, theOxford English Dictionarygives the earliest attestations of the term as being from England in the 1830s, defining it as 'the first week-day after Christmas-day, observed as a holiday on which post-men, errand-boys, and servants of various kinds expect to receive a Christmas-box'."Boxing-day,n.",OED Online, 1st edn (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1887).
The termChristmas-box, meanwhile, dates back to the seventeenth century, and amongst other things meant:

list.listitem: A present or gratuity given at Christmas: in Great Britain, usually confined to gratuities given to those who are supposed to have a vague claim upon the donor for services rendered to him as one of the general public by whom they are employed and paid, or as a customer of their legal employer; the undefined theory being that as they have done offices for this person, for which he has not directly paid them, some direct acknowledgement is becoming at Christmas."Christmas-box,n.",OED Online, 1st edn (Oxford: Oxford University Press, 1889), sense 3.

article.paragraph: In Britain, it was a custom for tradespeople to collect "Christmas boxes" of money or presents on the first weekday after Christmas as thanks for good service throughout the year.Encyclopdia Britannica, 1953 "Boxing day"This is mentioned inSamuel Pepys' diary entry for 19 December 1663.cite webhttp://www.pepysdiary.com/diary/1663/12/19/Saturday 19 December 1663 (Pepys' Diary)Pepysdiary.com26 December 2010This custom is linked to an older English tradition: since they would have to wait on their masters on Christmas Day, the servants of the wealthy were allowed the next day to visit their families. The employers would give each servant a box to take home containing gifts, bonuses and sometimes leftover food.

The European tradition, which has long included giving money and other gifts to those who were needy and in service positions, has been dated to theMiddle Ages, but the exact origin is unknown. It is believed to be in reference to the Alms Box placed in places of worship to collect donations to the poor. Also, it may come from a custom in the late Roman/early Christian era, wherein metal boxes placed outside churches were used to collect special offerings tied to theSt. Stephen's DayFeast of Saint Stephen,Collins, 2003, p. 38.which in theLatin ChurchWestern Churchfalls on the same day as Boxing Day.
article.heading: Date
article.paragraph: Boxing Day is asecular holidaythat is traditionally celebrated on 26 December, the day after Christmas Day. 26 December is alsoSt. Stephen's Day, areligious holiday.American Heritage Dictionary, Fourth Edition 'Boxing Day'Oxford Englishcite webhttp://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/pressreleases/stories/2004/11_november/17/radio4_sun26.shtmlBBC Radio 4 schedule, 3 December 200417 November 200417 December 2009When 26 December falls on a Sunday, Boxing Day in many Commonwealth countries and former British dominions is moved to 27 December. In the UK, Boxing Day is abank holiday. If Boxing Day falls on a Saturday, the following Monday is given as a substitute bank holiday. On the occasion when Christmas Day is on a Saturday and 26 December on a Sunday, the following Monday, 27 December, is the substitute bank holiday for Boxing Day and Tuesday, 28 December, the substitute bank holiday for Christmas Day.

InScotland, Boxing Day has been specified as an additional bank holiday since 1974,cite webhttp://www.london-gazette.co.uk/issues/46377/pages/9343London Gazette, 18 October 1974London-gazette.co.uk18 October 197426 December 2010byRoyal Proclamationunder theBanking and Financial Dealings Act 1971.cite webhttp://www.scotland.gov.uk/Topics/People/bank-holidays/FAQsBank Holidays in Scotland - Frequently Asked Questions21 December 2014

In Ireland  when the island as a whole was part of theUnited Kingdom of Great Britain and IrelandUnited Kingdom  theBank Holidays Act 1871established the feast day ofSt. Stephenas a non-movable public holiday on 26 December. Since the creation of theRepublic of IrelandfollowingPartition of Irelandpartition in 1920,Northern Irelandbeing part of the United Kingdom officially reverted to use of the British name 'Boxing Day'.

InAustralia, Boxing Day is a federal public holiday. In the Australian state of South Australia, 28 December is a public holiday known asProclamation Dayand Boxing Day is not normally a public holiday. The holiday for Proclamation Day is observed on the first weekday after Christmas Day or the Christmas Day holiday.Public HolidaysNowadays Boxing Day is popular in Australia as the first day of aTest cricketmatch held at theMCGand the annual Sydney to Hobart yacht race. A Test match is also often held in South Africa starting on Boxing Day.
InNew Zealand, Boxing Day is a statutory holiday; penalty rates and lieu time are provided to employees who work on the day.

InCanada, Boxing Day is a federal statutory holiday. Government offices, banks and post offices/delivery are closed. In some Canadian provinces, Boxing Day is a statutory holidaycite webhttp://www.gov.mb.ca/labour/standards/doc,gen-holidays-after-april-30-07,factsheet.html#q13Fact SheetManitoba Employment Standards Branch27 November 200917 December 2009that is always celebrated on 26 December. In Canadian provinces where Boxing Day was a statutory holiday, and it falls on a Saturday or Sunday, compensation days are given in the following week.

In theUnited States, Boxing Day is celebrated as a public holiday in some, mainlySouthern United Statessouthern, states: Kansas,cite webHolidays for State of Kansas Executive Branch Employeeshttp://admin.ks.gov/offices/personnel-services/holidaysDepartment of AdministrationState of Kansas8 October 2014Topeka, KAKentucky,cite webState Holidayshttps://personnel.ky.gov/pages/leave.aspxKentucky Personnel CabinetCommonwealth of Kentucky8 October 2014North Carolina,cite web2014 Holiday Schedulehttp://www.oshr.nc.gov/Holidays/holiday2014.pdfOffice of State Human ResourcesState of North Carolina8 October 2014Raleigh, NCpdfSouth Carolina,cite webSouth Carolina Code of Laws - Title 53 - Sundays, Holidays and Other Special Dayshttp://www.scstatehouse.gov/code/t53c005.phpLegislative Services AgencyState of South Carolina8 October 2014Columbia, SCand Texas.cite webOfficial Texas State Holidayshttps://www.tsl.texas.gov/ref/abouttx/holidays.htmlTexas State Library and Archives Commission8 October 2014Austin TX
article.heading: Shopping
article.paragraph: File:Boxing Day at the Toronto Eaton Centre.jpgthumbright276pxBoxing Day crowds shopping at theToronto Eaton Centrein Canada, 2007In the UK,cite newshttp://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/this-britain/boxing-day-sales-soar-as-shoppers-flock-to-malls-429935.htmlBoxing Day sales soar as shoppers flock to mallsTerry Kirby27 December 200617 December 2009LondonThe IndependentCanada,cite webhttp://www.ctv.ca/CTVNews/CTVNewsAt11/20051226/boxing_day_051226/Boxing Day expected to rake in $1.8 billionCTV.ca News Staff26 December 200517 December 2009and some states of Australia,cite webhttp://www.sbs.com.au/news/article/2014/12/26/boxing-day-sales-top-2bn-retailersBoxing Day sales to top $2bn: retailers26 December 201426 December 2014[[Special Broadcasting Service]]Boxing Day is primarily known as a shopping holiday, much likeBlack Friday (shopping)Black Friday(the day afterThanksgiving (United States)Thanksgiving) in the US. Boxing Day sales are common in Canada. It is a time when shops have sales, often with dramatic price reductions. For many merchants, Boxing Day has become the day of the year with the greatest number of returns. In the UK in 2009 it was estimated that up to 12 million shoppers appeared at the sales (a rise of almost 20% compared to 2008, although this was also affected by the fact that theVATwas about to revert to 17.5% from 1 January, following the temporary reduction to 15%).cite newshttp://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/business/8432144.stmBoxing Day sales attract 'record' number of shoppersBBC News28 December 200926 December 2010

Many retailers open very early (typically 5 am or even earlier) and offerdoorbusterdeals andloss leadersto draw people to their stores. It is not uncommon for long queues to form early in the morning of 26 December, hours before the opening of shops holding the big sales, especially atBig-box storebig-box consumer electronicsretailers.Many stores have a limited quantity of big draw or deeply discounted items.cite webhttp://toronto.ctv.ca/servlet/an/local/CTVNews/20071213/boxing_day_071213?hubHow to become a Boxing Day shopping pro25 December 2007Ashleigh Patterson17 December 2009Because of the shoulder-to-shoulder crowds, many choose to stay home and avoid the hectic shopping experience. The local media often cover the event, mentioning how early the shoppers began queuing up, providing video of shoppers queuing and later leaving with their purchased items.cite webhttp://www.ctv.ca/CTVNews/Canada/20071226/Boxing_Day_071226/Boxing Day begins with early rush of bargain hunterstoronto.ctv.ca26 December 200717 December 2009Many retailers have implemented practices aimed at managing large numbers of shoppers. They may limit entrances, restrict the number of patrons in a store at a time, provide tickets to people at the head of the queue to guarantee them a hot ticket item or canvass queued-up shoppers to inform them of inventory limitations.

In recent years, retailers have expanded deals to "Boxing Week". While Boxing Day is 26 December, many retailers will run the sales for several days before or after 26 December, often up to New Year's Eve. Notably, inLate 2000s recessionthe recession of late 2008, a record number of retailers were holding early promotions due to a weak economy.cite webhttp://www.ctv.ca/CTVNews/TopStories/20081221/Shopping_Deals_081222/Boxing Day comes early as shoppers search for dealsCTV.ca News Staff21 December 200817 December 2009Canada's Boxing Day has often been compared with the AmericanSuper Saturday, the Saturday before Christmas.

In some areas of Canada, particularly inAtlantic Canadaand parts ofNorthern Ontario, most retailers are prohibited from opening on Boxing Day, either by provincial law or municipalbylaw, or instead by informal agreement among major retailers to provide a day of relaxation following Christmas Day. In these areas, sales otherwise scheduled for 26 December are moved to the 27th.cite webhttp://www.geschenkhexe.ch/media/archive/Boxing-Day-The-Debate-Continues.htmlBoxing Day, The Debate Continuessoonews.ca22 December 200726 December 2009cite webhttp://www.google.com/hostednews/canadianpress/article/ALeqM5hAtdtyDSIeYttaUmCcZLT_bGhGzgBoxing Day madness: shoppers descend on stores looking for dealsThe Canadian Press26 December 200926 December 2009dead linkDecember 2011The city council ofGreater Sudbury,Ontario, which was the largest city in Canada to maintain this restriction as of the early 2010s, formally repealed its store hours bylaw on 9 December 2014."Council repeals Sudbury's store hours bylaw".Sudbury Star, 10 December 2014.

In 2009, many retailers with both online andHigh Streetstores launched their online sales on Christmas Eve and their High Street sales on Boxing Day.cite webhttp://www.geschenkhexe.ch/media/archive/IMRG-Press-Release-120m-to-be-spent-Online-on-Christmas-Day-2009.htmlMany retailers' sales to start on Christmas Eve22 December 2009IMRG22 December 2009cite newshttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/topics/christmas/6858609/Boxing-Day-sales-start-on-Christmas-Eve.htmlBoxing Day sales start on Christmas Eve22 December 2009Telegraph22 December 2009LondonThe Daily Telegraph
article.heading: Sport
article.paragraph: In the United Kingdom, it is traditional for thePremier League(England),Scottish Premiership(Scotland) andNIFL Premiership(Northern Ireland), as well as the lower divisions andRugby footballrugbyleagues, to hold a full programme ofassociation footballfootballandrugby unionmatches on Boxing Day. Traditionally, matches on Boxing Day are played againstlocal derbylocal rivals. This was originally to avoid teams and their fans having to travel a long distance to an away game on the day after Christmas Day. It also makes the day an important one in the sporting calendar. In Australia, New Zealand and South Africa, much anticipated cricket Test matches are played on Boxing Day. Prior to the formation of leagues, a number of importantRugby footballrugbyfixtures took place on Boxing Day notablyLlanelli RFCLlanellivLondon Welsh RFCLondon WelshandLeicester TigersLeicestervBarbarian F.C.The Barbarians.
In horse racing, there is theKing George VI ChaseatKempton Park Racecoursein Surrey. It is the second most prestigiousNational Hunt racingchasein Britain, after theCheltenham Gold Cup.

article.paragraph: Boxing Day is one of the main days in the hunting calendar forlist of foxhound packs of the United Kingdomhuntsin the UK and US, with most hunts (both mounted foxhound or harrier packs and foot packs of beagles or bassets) holding meets, often in town or village centres.cite webhttp://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/earth/countryside/10538429/Hundreds-of-thousands-turn-out-for-Boxing-Day-hunts.htmlHundreds of thousands turn out for Boxing Day hunts26 December 2013Telegraph.co.uk21 December 2014
Australia holds the first day of theBoxing Day TestinMelbourneat theMelbourne Cricket Groundand the start to theSydney to Hobart Yacht Race.
Australia'sNational Basketball League (Australia)National Basketball Leaguehas played on Boxing Day since the 199899 season.Citation neededNovember 2014

Severalice hockeycontests are associated with the day. TheIIHF World U20 Championshiptypically begins on 26 December, while theSpengler Cupalso begins on 26 December inDavos, Switzerland; the Spengler Cup competition includesHC Davos,Canada men's national ice hockey teamTeam Canada, and other top European Hockey teams. TheNational Hockey Leaguetraditionally had close to a full slate of games (10 were played in 2011cite webNHL Hockey Schedule for December 26, 2011http://www.nhl.com/ice/schedulebyday.htm?date27 August 2014), following the league-wide days off given for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day. However, the 2013 collective bargaining agreement (which followed2012-13 NHL lockouta lock-out) extended the league mandate of Christmas Eve and Christmas Day off to include Boxing Day, except when it falls on a Saturday, in which case the league can choose to make 23 December a league-wide off day instead for that year.cite webNational Hockey League CBA *Reference is on Page 101 - not digital page 101, the printed 101*http://www.nhl.com/nhl/en/v3/ext/CBA2012/NHL_NHLPA_2013_CBA.pdfhttp://www.nhl.com/nhl/en/v3/ext/CBA2012/NHL_NHLPA_2013_CBA.pdf27 August 2014In some AfricanCommonwealth of NationsCommonwealthnations, particularly Ghana, Uganda, Malawi, Zambia and Tanzania, prize fighting contests are held on Boxing Day. This practice has also been followed for decades in Guyana and Italy.cite webhttp://online.wsj.com/article/SB126179017496705483.html?modSeason's Beatings: 'Boxing Day' Takes a Pugilistic Turn14 November 2011MillmanJoel28 December 2009The Wall Street Journal (Asia Edition)

A notable tradition in Sweden isBoxing day bandyAnnandagsbandy, which formerly marked the start of the bandy season and always draw large crowds.
